results.title: Exploring mathematics: the weird number
results.brief_description: Presents an amusing introduction of rational numbers to a community of natural numbers. The weird number, 2/3, steals a piece of cake and then leads the major and the baker on a merry chase. Suitable middle and upper primary levels.

results.title: Exploring mathematics. Lost in the mish-mosh: area measure
results.brief_description: An animated cartoon in which Finite Sums and Dr Whatsup rescue a professor by solving a problem of area measure. Suitable for middle and upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: Exploring in space: the Van Allen radiation belts
results.creator_credit: Encyclopaedia Britannica Films and Charles Probst
results.brief_description: Dr James Van Allen and other scientists explain some of the purposes and methods of obtaining information in exploratory space flights. Uses animated drawings, models and live photography to visualise the relationships between the earth, the sun, the magnetosphere, and the radiation belts, and to explain how radio equipped space craft explore the radiation regions.

results.title: Explorers of the depths
results.brief_description: An account of the work of Scottish Fisheries Research to determine the causes of reduced fish catches in the North Sea. Sampling the sea-water and plankton at various depths, tagging fish, calculating the age of fish from their scale-ring, discovering the causes for the premature destruction of young fish - these are aspects of the research work which will prove of great importance to the fishermen of Scotland.

results.title: Explore Australia 1997 (PC & MAC)
results.brief_description: Explore Australia 1997 is a cyber guide for the desktop traveller, allowing the user to explore some of Australia’s top tourist destinations without leaving the comforts of home. Search thousands of towns, explore big city highlights, obtain information on Australia’s best national parks, and research accommodation Australia-wide. Easy to use, and can be linked to a companion website packed with additional information.

results.title: Explorations: wrestling
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Jacques Bobet, Michel Brault, Marcel Carriere, Claude Fournier and Claude Jutra
results.brief_description: A candid-camera view of professional wrestling as seen in the Montreal Forum, where some of the biggest bouts are staged, and in back-street wrestling parlors where the warriors practice their art. Nothing escapes the probing camera as well-muscled tyros grapple, punch, squirm, roar and grimace, adding their own variations of showmanship to amuse and excite the crowd.

results.title: Explorations of Prince Henry
results.brief_description: Presents an overview of the life of Prince Henry of Portugal during the age of exploration. Portrays the annihilation of the Muslims, the expansion of the Christian faith and the discovery of a sea route to India.

results.title: Explorations (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: University of Bristol. Dept. of Drama and George Brandt
results.brief_description: Portrays a drama class taught by Veronica Sherborne which explores ways of using movement as an approach to dramatic expression. Illustrates basic movement experiences that can give people a sense of confidence in their body mastery and creativity. Three themes are developed: a relation to and awareness of others; an awareness of the ground; and an awareness of one’s own body.

results.title: Exploding cities
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Barrie Howells and Tina Viljoen
results.brief_description: At the beginning of this century earth was still a rural planet. By the year 2000, two out of three of us will be living in cities. This film examines the causes of this massive migration, the terrible poverty that ensues, and what steps are being taken in some cities in the developing world to cope with the great influx of people. It also notes attempts made by some countries to deal with the problem, e.g. sites and services programs in Senegal and Pakistan, self-help construction projects in Colombia, and house upgrading schemes in Zambia. Voice and narration by Bronwyn Drainie.
